173.title: 1,561 youths joined militancy, 7,935 surrendered since 2016: Assam CM
173.article_body: As many as 1,561 youths have joined militant groups in Assam since 2016, said CM Himanta Biswa Sarma in a written reply in the state Assembly. "During the period 7,935 cadres of 23 different militant outfits surrendered and joined the mainstream," he added. A total of 84 persons have been arrested for Jihadi activities, he said.

174.title: Provocative song played in front of mosque in K'taka; case filed
174.article_body: The police have registered a suo moto case against organisers and a DJ owner after a provocative song was allegedly played in front of a mosque during a Ganesh Visarjan procession in Karnataka's Kalaburagi. This comes after a video of the incident surfaced online. The incident occurred on September 10 when the procession apparently stopped in front of the mosque.

175.title: 15,000 'overworked' nurses in US' Minnesota go on a 3-day strike
175.article_body: Some 15,000 nurses in the US state of Minnesota have gone on strike to protest against understaffing at hospitals. The Minnesota Nurses Association said health workers have been exhausted due to understaffing. The union said the three-day strike is one of the largest in the US history. Senator Bernie Sanders tweeted, "Nurses are the backbone of our health care system."

176.title: Viral video shows 3 kids travelling in open car boot in Telangana; police responds
176.article_body: A video showing three kids sitting in the boot of a moving car in Telangana went viral online. A Twitter user, who shared the video, sought action, saying, "How irresponsible parents they are?" Responding to the tweet, Cyberabad Traffic Police said, "Sir, your information has been verified and E-Challan has been generated. Thanks for joining hands...in improving road safety."

177.title: Mukul Rohatgi to return as Attorney General on October 1: Reports
177.article_body: Veteran lawyer Mukul Rohatgi is most likely to become the Attorney General for India again. According to reports, Rohatgi has agreed to succeed the current A-G KK Venugopal and is likely to begin his second tenure on October 1. Earlier, he had held the Attorney General post from June 2014 to June 2017.

178.title: Funeral directors' ad on hearse carrying Queen's body to Edinburgh removed mid-way
178.article_body: The branding of a funeral directors' company on Queen Elizabeth II's hearse was removed mid-way as it drove through Scotland. The sticker of the company, William Purves, was emblazoned on the vehicle as it departed Balmoral Castle on Sunday for a six-hour journey south to Holyroodhouse in Edinburgh. The company's website crashed after the advertisement was seen on the hearse.

179.title: BJP plunged J&K into unprecedented political uncertainty: Congress leader
179.article_body: The Congress on Monday alleged that BJP has pushed J&K into unprecedented political uncertainty by failing to maintain law and order in the Union Territory. "BJP...[has] been on a rampage of dispossessing and disempowering common people of Jammu and Kashmir. We've been used as political cannon fodders by BJP all across the country," J&K Congress chief Vikar Rasool Wani said.

180.title: KCR forming national party for his son: BJP MP K Laxman
180.article_body: After Telangana CM KCR announced that he will form a national political party, BJP MP K Laxman accused the CM of floating the national party for his son. "This party will be for his son to take over in Telangana...We have no problem with KCR forming a party at the national level or expanding his family party," said Laxman.

181.title: Road caves in due to sewerage pipe leak in Punjab's Ludhiana
181.article_body: A portion of a road has caved in near a level crossing in Punjab's Ludhiana with preliminary investigations revealing that the incident occurred due to leakage from the sewerage pipe of a nearby restaurant. A zonal commissioner said that the maintenance work will disrupt traffic as the area around the leakage needs to be dug up to check for damage.

182.title: BJP won't join freebie battle in Himachal Pradesh: CM Jairam Thakur
182.article_body: Himachal Pradesh CM Jairam Thakur said BJP will not join the freebie battle in the poll-bound state. Referring to the pre-poll freebies matter, Thakur added, "The people of Himachal are wise enough to sift through such hollow promises. They are not fools." Furthermore, he said that "the Congress is leaderless" in the absence of ex-CM late Virbhadra Singh.

183.title: 13-year-old raped by man she met online in Vadodara, accused held
183.article_body: A 13-year-old girl has been allegedly raped by a man she befriended on a social media site who lured her into accompanying him to a birthday party in Gujarat's Vadodara. The accused took her to his residence and threatened to kill her if she avoided his advances. The accused has been arrested following an FIR by the victim's father.

184.title: Nifty crosses 18,000 for 1st time since April, Sensex above 60,000
184.article_body: The benchmark indices opened in the green on Tuesday backed by gains across global markets. The Nifty opened 99.50 points up at 18,035.80, crossing the 18,000 mark for the first time since April 5. The Sensex also opened 329.73 points higher at 60,444.86 points. Stocks of Reliance Industries, Bajaj Finance, Titan Company and Infosys were among the major BSE gainers.

185.title: Rupee rises to 79.29 against US dollar, biggest jump in 3 weeks
185.article_body: The rupee registered its biggest jump in three weeks on Tuesday by gaining 23 paise to 79.29 against the US dollar from Monday's close of 79.52. The strengthening of the rupee was supported by a fall in global crude oil prices and also the American currency. The dollar index was last down by 0.2% at 107.9.

186.title: 'Only one will be left if I fight' says Ashok Chandna to Pilot after shoe thrown at him
186.article_body: After supporters of Rajasthan's former Deputy Chief Minister Sachin Pilot allegedly hurled shoes at meeting attended by BJP and Congress leaders, state Sports Minister Ashok Chandna named him in a tweet. "If Sachin Pilot becomes...Chief Minister by throwing...shoe at me...he should be made [CM] soon...I don't feel like fighting...The day I come to fight...only one will be left," he tweeted.

187.title: Priyanka Chopra shares glimpse of her walk-in closet in LA home
187.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra took to Instagram Stories to share a mirror selfie showing her walk-in closet in her Los Angeles residence with husband Nick Jonas. Brown and black boots can be seen on racks on one side of the walls. White shoes are mounted on shelves on the opposite side. Trolley bags can be seen lined up near the door.

188.title: Kareena Kapoor, Neetu Kapoor shoot together for first time; share pics
188.article_body: Actresses Kareena Kapoor and Neetu Kapoor will be sharing screen space for the first time. The two took to Instagram Stories to share pictures from the shoot of the unknown project. Kareena shared a selfie, writing, "When you shoot with family..." Neetu reposted the story, writing, "Loveee her." Neetu's late husband Rishi Kapoor and Kareena's father Randhir Kapoor are brothers.

189.title: Nation still bleeding, punish retired policeman who failed to act during 1984 riots: Delhi HC
189.article_body: Delhi High Court has granted liberty to Disciplinary Authority to issue "appropriate order of punishment" to a 79-year-old retired police officer who allegedly failed to deploy adequate force and make preventive detentions during the 1984 anti-Sikh riots. "He may be 100 (years old). Kindly see the misconduct. Innocent people lost their lives. The nation is still bleeding," the court said.

190.title: 2 bike-borne men shoot at woman sitting outside house in Delhi
190.article_body: A 55-year-old woman was injured after two bike-borne men allegedly shot at her in Delhi's Bhalswa Dairy area, police said on Tuesday. The woman, who is from Rajasthan, had come to meet her daughter in Prakash Vihar and was sitting outside the house with the daughter and her granddaughter when the incident occurred, DCP (Outer North) Devesh Kumar Mahla said.

191.title: FIR against 3 as 8 killed in fire at e-bike showroom at Secunderabad
191.article_body: An FIR has been filed against three persons after eight persons died following a massive fire that engulfed an electric bike showroom and a lodge above it at Secunderabad, police said. A case has been registered against the owner of the building and the showroom owner. The victims were all staying in the lodge located above the showroom, police added.

192.title: Ray of sun shines down on Queen's coffin; pic goes viral
192.article_body: A picture showing a ray of sun shining down on the Queen's coffin during a procession to transport her body to St Giles' Cathedral in Edinburgh has gone viral. The picture captured by Georgie Gillard was shared on Instagram by Story Picture Agency. Earlier, a double rainbow appeared over the Buckingham Palace after the demise of the Queen.

193.title: I have a bone edema issue, I couldn't run or walk: World no. 5 Zverev on injury
193.article_body: World number five Alexander Zverev, who hasn't played since June due to an ankle injury he suffered in his French Open semi-final against Rafa Nadal, has revealed that his comeback could be delayed by months due to a bone edema issue. "It causes me a lot of pain…it got to the point where I couldn't run or walk," he stated.

194.title: DVAC conducts searches at 26 places linked to ex-AIADMK minister SP Velumani
194.article_body: Directorate of Vigilance and Anti-Corruption is conducting searches at 26 places linked to former AIADMK minister SP Velumani in connection with allegations that he had abused his official position in awarding tenders injudiciously to his close associated companies. Meanwhile, Tamil Nadu Police detained seven AIADMK MLAs and several workers for protesting outside Velumani's Coimbatore residence.

195.title: Notice issued to textbook publisher over missing words in national anthem
195.article_body: UP Basic Education Department has issued a show-cause notice to a class 5 textbook publisher over national anthem being published with two words missing. Notices have also been issued to Basic Shiksha Adhikari (BSA) of Mathura and divisional education assistant director, Basic, Agra who were responsible for checking textbooks for any printing errors before they were distributed to students.

196.title: Police hooter should strike fear in criminals: UP CM Yogi Adityanath
196.article_body: UP CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday said a police hooter itself should strike fear in criminals and be enough to make them "tremble". "Criminals shouldn't be spared under any circumstances. From day one, we've taken pledge to eliminate criminals in UP and our government is doing it," CM Yogi added. He was reviewing the law and order situation in Baghpat.

197.title: We have retaken 6,000 sq km from Russia: Ukraine Prez Zelenskyy
197.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday said that since the beginning of the month, Ukrainian forces have retaken more than 6,000 square kilometers of Russian-held territory in the east and south. "The movement of our troops continues," Zelenskyy added. Russia had admitted losing key cities in the north-eastern Kharkiv region. Russia began its invasion of Ukraine on February 24.

198.title: Kerala govt plans to kill violent dogs, to seek SC permission
198.article_body: The Kerala government has decided to seek permission from the Supreme Court to kill rabid and violent dogs. The state is planning to conduct a month-long drive from September 20 to contain dog menace. "[The] situation is really serious…We have decided to…devise several plans to contain mounting dog bite cases," said Local Self Government Minister M B Rajesh.

199.title: Car catches fire on highway in Mumbai, Maha CM Shinde stops to help; video surfaces
199.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Tuesday stopped on Mumbai's Western Express Highway in the Vile Parle area to help the occupant of a car which caught fire. A video of the incident has surfaced online wherein Shinde can be seen speaking to the car driver. A fire official said that two fire engines were rushed and the fire was doused.

200.title: Men used to decide which actress they want to work with back then: Mandakini
200.article_body: Veteran actress Mandakini, who made her debut in 1985, has said that in those days, men used to decide which actress they want to work with. "That was a male-oriented period. During those days heroines were not very much in demand. They were just used only for 3-4 songs and very few romantic scenes," the actress added.

201.title: Parts of Bengaluru to face power cuts today and tomorrow
201.article_body: The Bangalore Electricity Supply Company Limited (BESCOM) said that there will be scheduled power shutdowns in the city for the rest of the month as it will carry out maintenance and repair works in rain-affected areas. BESCOM shared a list of places that will face power outages today and tomorrow which includes areas like Ramanagara, HSR Layout, Jayanagar, etc.

202.title: Indian-origin girl dies on b'day after being left alone for hours in Qatar school bus
202.article_body: A four-year-old Indian-origin girl, Minsa Mariyam Jacob, was found dead inside her school bus on her birthday in Qatar. Minsa, a kindergarten student, was locked inside the bus for hours after the crew didn't notice that she was sleeping. "The vehicle was left behind and she got stuck inside it in high heat," her relative said.

203.title: People attacked me on social media when I criticised Rizwan: Akram
203.article_body: Discussing Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan's 55 (49) in the Asia Cup final against Sri Lanka, ex-Pakistan captain Wasim Akram said, "(Rizwan)...[did] the same thing against Hong Kong." "I criticised him...People attacked me on social media," added Akram. "If you want my opinion, I will give you the...straightforward opinion. I'm not the guy who'll lie about what I see," he stated.

204.title: Shah removed Article 370 like teacher erases dirty letters: Union Minister
204.article_body: Union Minister Parshottam Rupala on Monday said that Home Minister Amit Shah removed Article 370 just like a "good teacher erases dirty letters from the blackboard". Rupala was speaking at World Dairy Summit 2022 at Greater Noida, which was also attended by Shah and UP CM Yogi Adityanath. Rupala praised Shah for his "tremendous amount of political will power".

205.title: I would love to work with Kapil: Asgar on returning to ‘The Kapil...’
205.article_body: Discussing his reaction to a potential offer from comedian Kapil Sharma over rejoining 'The Kapil Sharma Show', comedian Ali Asgar said, "I'd love to work with him...[and] do something new." "There's no enmity," added Asgar. Asgar had quit the show in 2017, stating he "can't cheat" as an artiste. Kapil had earlier stated that he'd "block" Asgar following his exit.

206.title: I think my opportunity will definitely come: Rahul Tripathi
206.article_body: Batter Rahul Tripathi, who is yet to make his India debut despite being part of squads for Ireland T20Is and Zimbabwe ODIs, has said that he's happy that he has now "at least come into the scheme of things". "I think my opportunity will definitely come, and my job is to keep performing in whatever opportunities I get," he added.

207.title: Pune to face water cuts from 10 pm on Sept 14 to 10 pm on Sept 15
207.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation has announced that parts of the city will face water cuts from 10 pm on September 14 to 10 pm on September 15 due to the planned installation of flow meters. Water supply will resume on September 16 in the morning with low pressure, it added. Places like Fatimanagar and Pune Cantonment Board area will be affected.

208.title: Cong harboured hatred for us, wants to connect people through hatred: RSS
208.article_body: RSS Joint General Secretary Dr Manmohan Vaidya on Monday said that the Congress wants to connect people through hatred. "Can you unite India through hatred? They have harboured hatred and contempt for us for a long time. Their earlier generations too tried to stop the RSS but we kept growing as we were supported by the people," Vaidya added.

209.title: Always resorting to slander: Banerjee to Opposition leaders criticising Bengal
209.article_body: Days after Enforcement Directorate (ED) seized cash worth crores from a Kolkata-based businessman, CM Mamata Banerjee criticised some political parties for trying to only create a negative image of the state. "They are always resorting to slander. Had they highlighted the positive works of the state government, both Bengal and its people would have benefited," she said.

210.title: 32-year-old co-pilot found dead at home in Delhi, probe underway
210.article_body: Police have started investigation after a 32-year-old co-pilot with a private airline was found dead at his residence in Delhi’s Palam. The deceased, who was reportedly found dead on Saturday, was married and hailed from Kerala, officials said. Police suspected it to be a suicide, adding that the deceased might have taken the step as he failed in an exam.

211.title: 2 arrested for planting explosive near basketball ground in Imphal
211.article_body: Two people have been arrested for planting an Improvised Explosive Device (IED) near a basketball ground at Singjamei Chingamakha in Manipur's Imphal, said police. One of the two suspects, Kshetrimayum Bhogendro Singh, who was caught first, revealed he is an active member of insurgent group UNLF, according to police. His disclosure led to the arrest of the other suspect.

212.title: We shot in -22°C, I had nosebleeds, bruises, allergies: Mrunal on 'Sita Ramam'
212.article_body: While talking about her movie 'Sita Ramam', actress Mrunal Thakur said that shooting for it was challenging. "There are so many layers in the character. And you would not believe it, the weather over there was so challenging. We've shot in like minus 22 degrees, in places where I've had like nosebleeds, bruises and allergies," she added.

213.title: Fresh clashes erupt between Azerbaijan, Armenia
213.article_body: Fresh clashes between Armenian and Azerbaijan forces were reported on Monday, which has left an unknown number of troops dead. The fighting reportedly took place in the disputed Nagorno-Karabakh region, and both the countries have blamed each other for the initial provocations. The two sides had fought a six-week-long war over Nagorno-Karabakh in 2020, which ended with a Russian-brokered deal.

214.title: Saba Azad reveals why she changed name from Saba Grewal, says 'Azad was nani’s pen name'
214.article_body: Singer-actress Saba Azad has revealed why she changed her name from Saba Grewal, stating, "My father is of Sikh origin and my mother of Muslim, but neither practiced religion." Adding that Azad was her nani's (grandmother) pen name, she said, "I liked the...meaning...The want for freedom is the most human instinct. So I adopted it as my stage name."

215.title: Goldman Sachs preparing for layoffs across all departments in Sept: Report
215.article_body: Goldman Sachs is preparing to make its first round of layoffs since the outbreak of the pandemic, as per a report. It is expected to cut jobs across all departments as soon as next week. The bank usually initiates a round of layoffs, called Strategic Resource Assessment, annually, on the basis of employee performance and can terminate 1-5% of workers.

216.title: Nintendo shares surge 5% after record launch sales of 'Splatoon 3'
216.article_body: Shares of Nintendo surged 5% on Tuesday after the gaming company reported domestic launch sales of over 3.45 million units for its shooter "Splatoon 3" on the Switch console. "Splatoon 3", which was launched on September 9, exceeded the sales of "Animal Crossing: New Horizons" and "Super Smash Bros. Ultimate", which respectively sold 39.4 million and 28.8 million units globally.

217.title: HDFC Life Insurance shares surge 2.5% after reports of block deal
217.article_body: Shares of HDFC Life Insurance surged in Tuesday's opening trade after reports of a block deal in which around 43 million shares, or a 2% stake of the firm, changed hands. At 9:17 am, its stock was trading at ₹594 on the BSE, a jump of 2.5%. Edinburgh-based Abrdn is reportedly expected to offload 43 million shares in the company.

218.title: What is inside the 2022 Emmy Awards' gift bag?
218.article_body: Celebrities will receive a trip to Four Seasons Nevis in the West Indies. Other trip alternatives for Emmys 2022 attendees include three-night stay at the RiverView Ranch Retreat & Western Adventures in Montana and a three-night stay at the Museum Hotel in Cappadocia, Turkey. The gift bag also has skincare products, canned drinks, bag of caramels and everyday essentials.

219.title: Asif batted with 4 stitches, Shadab's ear was bleeding: Pak's Saqlain on Asia Cup final
219.article_body: Pakistan head coach Saqlain Mushtaq has revealed that Asif Ali batted with four stitches in his hand and Shadab Khan batted despite his ear bleeding during the Asia Cup 2022 final. Asif was dismissed for a golden duck while Shadab got out for eight runs off six deliveries as Pakistan lost the final by 23 runs.

220.title: Surprised at omission of Shreyas & Shami: Azharuddin on India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad
220.article_body: Ex-India captain Mohammed Azharuddin took to Twitter to share that he is surprised at the omission of batter Shreyas Iyer and fast bowler Mohammad Shami from India's main T20 World Cup 2022 squad. "Shreyas instead of Deepak Hooda and Shami in the place of Harshal Patel would be my choice," he added. Shreyas and Shami have been named as standbys.

221.title: Attacked by monkeys, 5-year-old boy falls to death from roof in UP
221.article_body: A five-year-old boy playing on the roof of his house fell to death after he was reportedly attacked by a group of monkeys in UP's Budaun district on Sunday. The victim, Nikhil, was rushed to a hospital but he did not survive. His family refused to send the body for autopsy, said a police official.

222.title: Infosys warns staff against moonlighting, says 'No two-timing, no double lives': Report
222.article_body: Infosys has warned employees against dual employment or 'moonlighting', stating that any violation will lead to disciplinary action, including termination of employment, the Times of India reported. With the taglines 'No two-timing, no moonlighting' and 'No double lives', Infosys told employees they cannot take up other assignments during or outside business hours without seeking its consent.

223.title: Supreme Court Collegium clears names of 20 judges for High Courts
223.article_body: The Supreme Court Collegium, headed by Chief Justice of India UU Lalit, has cleared the names of 20 judges for the High Courts of Punjab and Haryana, Bombay and Karnataka. Those recommended for elevation include 15 judicial officers, three Additional Judges and two advocates. Nine judicial officers have been elevated as judges in Punjab and Haryana High Court.

224.title: SC asks govt to pay ₹10 lakh to man who claimed to have spent 14 yrs in Pak jail as spy
224.article_body: Supreme Court has ordered Centre to pay ₹10 lakh to 75-year-old Mahmood Ansari, who claimed to have worked as a spy in the 1970s and served 14 years in Pakistani jail under the espionage charge. Ansari was terminated from his job in India in 1980. "The standard practice of any government is to disown its special agents," the court observed.

225.title: Punjab gym owner locks door from inside, shoots himself in head; critical
225.article_body: A 32-year-old gymnasium owner in Punjab's Ludhiana allegedly shot himself in the head with his revolver at his gym on Monday. His condition is said to be critical. Reports said that he had bolted the door from inside before taking the step. His wife had sent someone to check after he did not respond to calls.

226.title: 'Squid Game' star Lee Jung-jae 1st Asian to win Emmy for lead actor in drama series
226.article_body: South Korean actor Lee Jung-jae won the award for lead actor in a drama series for his role in 'Squid Game' at the 74th Primetime Emmy Awards. He is the first Asian actor to win the award and the first to win it for a non-English-speaking role. Notably, 'Squid Game' was the first non-English language series nominated in Drama category.

227.title: Acceptance from audience only reward we work for: Ayan on Brahmāstra success
227.article_body: Ayan Mukerji took to Instagram to pen a note about the success of his directorial 'Brahmāstra'. He wrote, "The Acceptance from Audiences - is the only reward we work for at the movies. We were also the #1 Movie at the Global Box-Office this weekend...another source of pride, excitement and progress, for us!" 'Brahmāstra' stars Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt.

228.title: Light rain, drizzle expected in parts of Delhi: IMD
228.article_body: The India Meteorological Department has predicted light rain and drizzle in parts of Delhi today. "As the depression moves and comes closer towards northwest India, the rain intensity will increase. On Wednesday, strong winds are expected, which will be accompanied by light rain. On Thursday, light to moderate rain will occur around Delhi," said IMD scientist RK Jenamani.

229.title: Kenan jokes about Leonardo's girlfriends, Oscars slap in Emmys monologue
229.article_body: Actor-comedian Kenan Thompson hosted the 2022 Primetime Emmy Awards and joked about actor Leonardo DiCaprio's girlfriends and Will Smith slapping Chris Rock at the Oscars 2022 in his opening monologue. He said, "Zendaya just turned 26 last week. 26 is a weird age in Hollywood...You're young enough to play a high school student but...too old to date Leonardo DiCaprio."

230.title: Helping 2000+ professionals in switching to Data Science career: Scaler
230.article_body: Scaler's Data Science & Machine Learning with Analytics program is helping 2000+ working professionals to switch their career paths and transition to data science. With a chance to learn hands-on with 80+ business case studies, more working professionals are choosing this online course without quitting jobs, it stated. For those looking to transition from non-tech backgrounds to data science, the Free Class has been the perfect place to start, stated Scaler.

231.title: 30-year-old rapper PnB Rock dies after being shot, robbed at a restaurant in US
231.article_body: Rapper PnB Rock, whose real name was Rakim Allen, passed away after he was shot multiple times at a restaurant in Los Angeles, US. The 30-year-old was dining at the restaurant with his girlfriend when a man brandished a firearm, demanding jewellery from him. A location-tagged photo posted by his girlfriend is believed to have led assailants to his location.

232.title: India reports 4,369 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 46,347
232.article_body: India has reported 4,369 COVID-19 cases and 18 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 5,221 COVID-19 cases. Active cases in the country stood at 46,347, while the daily positivity rate stood at 1.25%. India reported 5,178 recoveries in the last 24 hours.

233.title: JD(U) spokesperson Nikhil Mandal resigns citing 'personal' reasons
233.article_body: JD(U) spokesperson Nikhil Mandal resigned from the post citing "personal reasons". "In these six years, seven months and 12 days, I received immense love and respect from all the media colleagues, for which I thank all of you from my heart," he said. Mandal had contested the 2020 Assembly elections from Madhepura which he had lost to RJD's Dr Chandrashekhar.

234.title: Demolition process of Mumbai's illegal Gulistan Apartments begins
234.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has started the demolition process of the Gulistan Apartments, which is a building with 90 flats, in Mumbai and disconnected the electricity and water supply on Monday. "As this is a sensitive issue, we waited for Ramzan and Ganeshotsav...We will bring it to ground zero at the earliest," an officer who oversees the demolition said.

235.title: Don't celebrate Hindi Diwas on taxpayer's money: Kumaraswamy to K'taka CM
235.article_body: JD(S) leader HD Kumaraswamy on Monday urged Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai not to celebrate Hindi Diwas by utilising the taxpayers' money. In a letter, the former Karnataka Chief Minister noted that thousands of languages, dialects, and diverse social and cultural practices make India a "great union". "In such a land, celebrating one particular language is injustice," Kumaraswamy added.

236.title: Rajasthan government is insensitive towards cow protection: Rajyavardhan
236.article_body: BJP MP Rajyavardhan Rathore accused the Rajasthan government of being insensitive towards cows and claimed that the government is running away from the responsibility of protecting the "Gauvansh" in the state. "Thousands of cattle have died in Rajasthan due to lumpy skin disease. More than 10 lakh cows are affected...The government is not worried about protecting the cows," said Rathore.

237.title: K'taka HC told hijab is essential religious practice, had to interpret Quran: SC
237.article_body: A Supreme Court bench hearing the petition over the hijab ban in Karnataka schools and colleges has stated that the High Court had no option but to interpret the Quran. The petitioners had stated that while determining whether hijab was an essential religious practice, the HC's observation was objectionable since the court should not have embarked upon interpreting Quran.

238.title: Helping 2000+ professionals in switching to Data Science career: Scaler
238.article_body:
Scaler's Data Science & Machine Learning with Analytics program is helping 2000+ working professionals to switch their career paths and transition to data science. With a chance to learn hands-on with 80+ business case studies, more working professionals are choosing this online course without quitting jobs, it stated.

For those looking to transition from non-tech backgrounds to data science, the Free Class has been the perfect place to start, stated Scaler.

239.title: 'Taarak Mehta...' actor Shailesh Lodha replaced by Sachin Shroff
239.article_body: Shailesh Lodha, who portrayed Taarak Mehta in television show 'Taarak Mehta Ka Ooltah Chashmah', has been replaced by Sachin Shroff. The show's producers said, "With Shailesh, we had tried a lot to find a middle ground but he left the show...Viewers can't be kept waiting." Sachin has featured in 'Sinndoor Tere Naam Ka', 'Tumhari Paakhi' and 'Aashram 3' among others.

240.title: I'll be thinking about pulling out of WBBL: Mandhana on workload
240.article_body: India Women vice-captain Smriti Mandhana has said she'll consider pulling out of the upcoming Women's Big Bash League (WBBL) to manage her workload. "Because I don't want to miss out on playing for India," she stated. "Post the one-day World Cup, I have been on the road [with the Sri Lanka tour, the Commonwealth Games, the Women's Hundred]," added Mandhana.

241.title: Wife of Sarabjit Singh, who was killed in Pak jail, dies after falling off 2-wheeler
241.article_body: Sukhpreet Kaur, the wife of Indian national Sarabjit Singh who was killed in Pakistan jail in 2013, passed away on Monday. She was a pillion rider on a two-wheeler when she accidentally fell from it near Fatehpur in Punjab, police said. Her cremation is scheduled to take place at her native place Bhikhiwind in Tarn Taran on Tuesday.

242.title: Pune's BORI to launch online learning platform for Indology courses
242.article_body: Pune-based Bhandarkar Oriental Research Institute (BORI) is going to launch an online learning platform named 'Bharat Vidya', through which courses on Indology will be offered. The platform will include courses on Indic languages, art, culture, science and philosophy.  As many as ten courses on subjects, including the Vedas, Mahabharata and Sanskrit, will be offered initially.

243.title: What security will you give, you should be ashamed: Kejriwal to Guj Police
243.article_body: While talking about security protocols, Aam Aadmi Party chief Arvind Kejriwal told the Gujarat Police that they should be ashamed of themselves. "What security will you give, you have a (black) spot on you," he added. When reminded about security protocol in the state, Kejriwal said, "It is this protocol that has saddened the people of Gujarat...The public is unhappy."

244.title: Bus crashes into driving instructor's shop in Punjab; 12 injured
244.article_body: At least 12 people were injured after a private bus crashed into a roadside shop, which belongs to a driving instructor, in Punjab's Banga on Monday. The bus conductor, who was also injured, told police that the driver was drowsy and wanted to stop. The shop owner said that he had gone for a driving lesson when the incident occurred.

245.title: India's industrial growth slows to 4-month low of 2.4% in July
245.article_body: India's industrial production growth slowed to a four-month low of 2.4% in July from 12.7% in June, official data showed on Monday. This was driven by poor showing by the manufacturing, power and mining sectors, the data further showed. Industrial growth, which is based on the Index of Industrial Production (IIP), had hit a one-year high of 19.6% in May.

246.title: Prince Harry banned from wearing military uniform at Queen vigil
246.article_body: Prince Harry has been banned from wearing military uniform as he mourns the Queen. Only working Royals have been permitted to dress in uniform at five ceremonial occasions. Earlier on Monday, Harry wrote about his special memories of when the Queen attended his passing out parade in 2006 when he became an officer in the British Army.

247.title: 2022 could be the wettest year in Bengaluru's history: IMD
247.article_body: With over 1,590 mm of rain having already been reported this year, 2022 could be the wettest year in the history of Bengaluru, said India Meteorological Department (IMD). The city is likely to surpass the previous high of 1,615 mm of rain recorded in 2017. "The amount of rain this year was unprecedented," said an IMD official.

248.title: UP CM Yogi Adityanath visits Jewar airport site to check work
248.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath visited Noida International Airport site in Jewar on Sunday to check the ongoing work. "Increase the machinery and resources at the airport site to ensure that the project is completed as soon as possible. This airport is extremely important for the overall development of the entire region," the UP CM said.

249.title: What happens to banknotes worth $95 billion in UK with Queen Elizabeth's face?
249.article_body: The Bank of England has said that banknotes and coins bearing Queen Elizabeth's face will continue to be accepted as forms of payment and that the formal declaration regarding the country’s currency will be made seven days after the Queen's funeral. It is estimated that banknotes worth $95 billion and about 29 billion coins are in circulation in the UK.

250.title: Atmosphere of anger, hatred generated by a particular ideology: Rahul
250.article_body: Every single person in this country is Indian and if anybody hates any other Indian then he is hating the idea of India itself, Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said on Monday. "Today, we have an atmosphere of anger and hatred generated by a particular ideology," Gandhi added while addressing a gathering in Thiruvananthapuram.

251.title: UP CM reviews debris disposal post Noida twin tower demolition
251.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath on Monday reviewed the post-demolition debris management of the Noida twin towers, razed on August 28. "The CM was informed that the waste processing unit has a daily capacity of 350 tonnes to 400 tonnes...However, the unit is now functioning at 700 tonnes a day capacity," the Noida Authority said.

252.title: Hannah Waddingham reveals she is wearing sneakers under gown at Emmys; pic viral
252.article_body: Hannah Waddingham has revealed that she prioritised comfort on the red carpet at Emmy Awards, with the actress choosing sneakers over heels. Speaking about her decision to wear sneakers with her pale pink Dolce & Gabbana gown, Waddingham said, "Do you know what the best thing about things like this is? Nobody knows that I don't have heels on underneath."

253.title: 1 die, 4 injured as shuttering of under-construction building collapses in UP
253.article_body: A labourer was killed and four others were injured after the shuttering of an under-construction forensics institute collapsed in Lucknow's Sarojini Nagar on Monday, police said. Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has constituted a three-member committee to probe into the incident. CM Yogi has also directed the officials to release compensation to the deceased's family.

254.title: Disappointing, painful: Muslim body on court order in Gyanvapi case
254.article_body: The All India Muslim Personal Law Board (AIMPLB) said that the Varanasi district court's order in the Gyanvapi case is very "disappointing" and "painful". "The government should strongly protect the 1991 Worship Act otherwise the minority community will be disappointed...and will feel that all the doors of justice are closed for them," AIMPLB said in a statement.

255.title: BMC to inspect cattle sheds in Mumbai to check lumpy skin disease
255.article_body: In order to check the lumpy skin disease outbreak, the Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) has decided to visit various cattle sheds in Mumbai. The civic body will visit the sheds in teams and issue notices to owners if the sheds are unclean. Further, the BMC will also provide medical treatment to animals found infected with the disease, officials said.

256.title: Iran using military facilities in Syria to produce missiles: Israel
256.article_body: Israeli Defence Minister Benny Gantz has accused Iran of using military facilities in Syria to produce advanced missiles and weapons for its proxies. Iran is also working on building missile and weapons industries in Lebanon and Yemen, Gantz said, adding, "If this trend will not be stopped, within a decade, there'll be advanced Iranian industries across the region...spreading terror."

257.title: Zendaya becomes 1st Black woman to win Emmy for lead actress in drama series twice
257.article_body: Zendaya has become the first Black woman to win the Emmy for lead actress in a drama series twice. In 2020, she became the youngest-ever Emmy winner for the outstanding lead actress in a drama series category. This is the second time she won the award for her role in HBO series 'Euphoria'.

258.title: Got a 1-line idea for 'No Entry 2' in 2016, everyone agreed upon it: Anees
258.article_body: While talking about 'No Entry 2', filmmaker Anees Bazmee said the team came up with a one-line idea in 2016 and everyone agreed on it. "Developing a script around this one-line idea and then writing the dialogues took a lot of time...to make...a film where people don't have to use brains...we have to work our mind a lot," he added.

259.title: Boucher to step down as South Africa head coach after 2022 T20 World Cup
259.article_body: South Africa head coach Mark Boucher will step down from his role after the 2022 T20 World Cup in October-November, Cricket South Africa has announced. Boucher, who became the head coach in December 2019, had been contracted until the end of the 2023 ODI World Cup. Notably, the announcement came hours after SA lost their three-Test series against England 1-2.

260.title: Want to interview Karan Johar, what's this desperation: Kangana on Brahmastra
260.article_body: While talking about Alia Bhatt-Ranbir Kapoor starrer 'Brahmastra', actress Kangana Ranaut said that she wants to interview filmmaker Karan Johar and understand why he is declaring a gross collection of the film and not a net collection. "What is this desperation? Even if we believe them, how come ₹650 crore film emerged a hit already," she wrote on Instagram Stories.

261.title: Farmer gets ₹5.65 crore for giving up 2.05 acres for Pune Ring Road
261.article_body: A farmer from Urse has been given a compensation of ₹5.65 crore for giving up 2.05 acres of land for the Pune Ring Road project by the Maharashtra State Road Development Corporation (MSRDC). "We have given compensation to one farmer on a figurative basis and the final list of compensation is being readied," said an official.

262.title: 350 PMC workers clean manholes after rainfall causes waterlogging
262.article_body: Around 350 workers from the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) were cleaning manholes and stormwater drainage lines at 80 locations in the city on Monday after rainfall caused waterlogging. "We have deployed 25 people in each ward office to expedite the work of clearing choked drainage lines. We finished 80% of work today," PMC Drainage Department head Santosh Tandale said.

263.title: Who won what at the Emmy Awards 2022?
263.article_body: At Emmy Awards 2022, Zendaya and Lee Jung-jae won the awards for the lead actress and actor in drama series for 'Euphoria' and 'Squid Game', respectively. Meanwhile, Jean Smart and Jason Sudeikis won lead actress and actor in comedy series awards for 'Hacks' and 'Ted Lasso', respectively. 'Succession' won outstanding drama series award. 'Ted Lasso' won outstanding comedy series award.

264.title: Court convicts 2 AAP MLAs for rioting, attacking policemen in 2015 case
264.article_body: A Delhi court convicted AAP MLAs Akhilesh Pati Tripathi and Sanjeev Jha for rioting and attacking policemen at Delhi's Burari Police Station in 2015. The quantum of the sentence will be announced on September 21. "The prosecution has been able to prove...accused persons...were part of the unlawful assembly...had provoked the crowd and encouraged them to get violent," the court said.

265.title: Girl walking back home dies after iron gate falls on her in Delhi
265.article_body: A 13-year-old girl, who was walking back home from school, died after an iron gate fell on her and the iron rods on top of it struck her head in Delhi's Khajuri Khas. The girl was taken to a hospital where she was declared dead during treatment. Two other girls, who were walking with the deceased, were not injured.

266.title: No buffalo meat supply in Mumbai from today as govt bans transportation
266.article_body: There will be no supply of buffalo meat in Mumbai as the authorities placed a restriction on cattle transportation due to outbreak of lumpy skin disease, Mumbai Municipal Commissioner said. "We have banned transport of cattle and buffalo from other states to Maharashtra as well as the transport of these animals between districts," state dairy and animal husbandry minister said.

267.title: HCL fires 350 employees globally who were working on Microsoft project: Report
267.article_body: HCL Technologies fired 350 employees globally who were working on its client Microsoft’s news-related products, as per a report. The employees were informed about this during a town hall last week. As per the report, these employees will be offered severance pay and were laid off from geographies including India, Guatemala and the Philippines, among others.

268.title: Probe on Instagram page Jhamunda after operator stalks couples in Hyderabad
268.article_body: A probe has been launched on Instagram page 'Jhamunda' after its operator allegedly stalked couples and uploaded their pictures and videos. Reports said three cases were filed against the page after people noticed their videos uploaded on the page and notified Hyderabad police. "A special team has been constituted to dig into the 'Jhamunda' page and its activities," police said.

269.title: 8 killed in fire at e-bike showroom near Hyderabad, several jump from building
269.article_body: Eight people were killed and several were injured in a major fire that broke out in an e-bike showroom on the ground floor of a building and spread to a hotel located on the first and second floors in Secunderabad. Several people jumped out of their hotel rooms. Telangana Home Minister Mohammed Mahmood Ali said the incident is being probed.

270.title: It took us close to 7 years for VFX: 'Brahmastra' co-producer Namit
270.article_body: Talking about 'Brahmastra', the film's co-producer Namit Malhotra said, "I had a running joke with [director] Ayan Mukerji that after James Cameron, he's the only guy who's taken this long (for a film)." Namit added it took them close to seven years to finish the film's VFX. "We made 'Brahmastra' for half the cost of a Hollywood movie," he stated.

271.title: Activist jailed for 2 years for insulting Thailand's Queen
271.article_body: A Thailand court has sentenced an activist who dressed as Queen Suthida during a protest in 2020 to two years in prison for insulting the monarchy, the activist's lawyer said. Jatuporn Saeoueng, in October 2020, walked a red carpet at a demonstration wearing a pink dress with a fellow protester holding an umbrella while other protesters sat on the ground.

272.title: Blue Origin's uncrewed rocket crashes to Earth a minute after launch, video surfaces
272.article_body: A Blue Origin rocket crashed back to Earth just a minute after it was launched on Monday, marking the first launch failure for the Jeff Bezos-led space travel company. While the uncrewed capsule parachuted back to Earth after its abort system kicked in, the rocket came crashing down. "It appears we've experienced an anomaly...This wasn't planned," the launch commentary announced.

273.title: Majority Twitter shareholders vote in favour of sale to Musk: Report
273.article_body: A majority of Twitter shareholders reportedly voted in favour of the company's $44 billion sale to Tesla CEO Elon Musk. Shareholders were expected to vote in favour after Twitter's stock price went from $54.20 apiece in April to around $41 apiece currently. Twitter and Musk will go to trial in October to resolve his attempt to cancel the acquisition deal.

274.title: 20-yr-old man climbs onto train roof in Mumbai, suffers 80% burns
274.article_body: A 20-year-old man suffered 80% burn injuries after accidentally touching the overhead wire of a parked train at a railway yard in Mumbai on Monday. The victim, identified as Aman Shaikh, works as a loading-unloading agent at a shop in Jogeshwari East. "He had his mobile phone in...hand when he suffered...shock and was possibly taking selfies," an official said.

275.title: Pune records highest number of swine flu cases, deaths in Maha in 2022
275.article_body: Pune has recorded the highest number of swine flu cases at 540 and 36 deaths in Maharashtra in 2022, according to a report. At least 880 persons were swine flu positive since January till date, as per PMC data. As many as 2,992 persons have been infected with swine flu and there have been 147 deaths across Maharashtra this year.

276.title: I wanted to see someone fat like me in the media: Singer Lizzo after her Emmy win
276.article_body: After accepting the Emmy Award for Outstanding Competition Program for her reality series 'Lizzo's Watch Out For The Big Grrrls', singer Lizzo said, "When I was a little girl, all I wanted to see was me in the media. Someone fat like me, Black like me, beautiful like me." "I'm very emotional. The trophy is nice," she further said.

277.title: We put ourselves out there, kudos to us: Neelam on 'Fabulous...' criticism
277.article_body: While talking about the criticism the show 'Fabulous Lives Of Bollywood Wives 2' gets from viewers, actress Neelam Kothari said that she and others attempted something and that it has been successful. "We put ourselves out there and kudos to us...if you make a movie or a serial, you will have lovers and you will have haters," she said.

278.title: Bengaluru reports 218 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death
278.article_body: Bengaluru reported 218 new COVID-19 infections on Monday, taking the cumulative total to 18,68,794 cases, Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) Chief Commissioner said. One patient died of the infection, taking the total death toll to 16,984 in the city. The number of active cases was 2,540, while the infection positivity rate stood at 2.21%.

279.title: Arsenal's Europa League match against PSV cancelled due to lack of police
279.article_body: Arsenal's Europa League match against PSV Eindhoven scheduled for Thursday in London has been postponed due to a lack of police resources. The London Police is currently concentrating its resources on Queen Elizabeth II's body lying in state from Wednesday till her funeral on Monday. Arsenal's Premier League match with Brentford on Sunday is also in doubt, claim reports.

280.title: 3 arrested amid movement of Queen Elizabeth's coffin in Edinburgh
280.article_body: Three people were arrested in Edinburgh for allegedly causing disturbances on Sunday and Monday as Queen Elizabeth's coffin was moved around the city, Scottish police informed. A 22-year-old woman and a 74-year-old man were arrested separately on Sunday, Reuters reported, adding that the woman had been pictured holding an anti-monarchy sign. The third arrest was reportedly made on Monday.

281.title: Never really smiled, always serious: Shaquille O'Neal on Kobe Bryant
281.article_body: Retired basketball legend Shaquille O'Neal said his former LA Lakers teammate, late Kobe Bryant, was someone who "never really smiled" and "was always serious". O'Neal also revealed that Bryant followed Michael Jordan "very closely" and adapted most of his mannerisms on and off the court. Both O'Neal and Bryant together won three championships for the LA Lakers.

282.title: Only time in history they don't do the rule: Hamilton on Italian GP
282.article_body: Mercedes F1's Lewis Hamilton said the Italian GP ending behind the safety car was "only one time in the history" that the FIA did not follow the norm. "It always brings memories back. That is the rule that it should be, right?" he said. Hamilton lost the title last year due to a different interpretation of the safety car rule.

283.title: Smriti Irani's family firm, Goa bar owner had lease agreement: Activist
283.article_body: During a hearing, activist Aires Rodrigues showed a lease agreement that was signed between a firm allegedly linked to Union Minister Smriti Irani's family and the owners of Goa's Silly Soul Café and Bar. The restaurant owner's lawyer claimed that the agreement never culminated in a deed. Rodrigues had complained against the alleged illegal renewal of the restaurant's excise license.

284.title: Matches against Spain will be mock test ahead of hockey WC: PR Sreejesh
284.article_body: Indian hockey goalkeeper PR Sreejesh said that the opening two FIH Pro League matches against Spain will be a "mock test" ahead of the next year's hockey World Cup in Bhubaneswar and Rourkela. "It will also help us in providing young players [with] the experience of playing high-level hockey...It will...help us [in] setting the tempo for the WC," Sreejesh said.

285.title: J&K people have no rights, no forum to project grievances: Mehbooba
285.article_body: PDP chief Mehbooba Mufti said that Jammu and Kashmir is currently at such a crossroads where people do not have any rights, nor do they have a forum to project their grievances. She said that the LG administration is showcasing "phoney achievements". Mufti added that the BJP-run administration is only weaponising the pain of Kashmiri Pandits for political objectives.

286.title: Death toll from earthquake in China reaches 93, search on for 25
286.article_body: The death toll from the magnitude 6.8 earthquake that hit China's Sichuan province last week has risen to 93, authorities said. As many as 25 people remain missing as of Sunday evening, rescuers informed, according to state news channel CCTV. More than 50,000 people were relocated in the immediate aftermath of the earthquake due to damaged buildings.

287.title: Premier League solely responsible for Superleague idea: Ex-Bayern CEO
287.article_body: Former Bayern Munich CEO Karl-Heinz Rummenigge has claimed that it is the Premier League's six richest clubs that were responsible for the controversial European Superleague last year. "The big instigator is solely England. This idea came about because of the income in the Premier League," said Rummenigge. Bayern Munich was the biggest club that refused to participate in the Superleague.

288.title: I'd have probably got Shami instead of Harshal: Kris on India's T20 WC squad
288.article_body: Commenting on India's 15-member squad for upcoming T20 World Cup 2022, ex-chairman of BCCI's selection committee Kris Srikkanth said he would've probably picked pacer Mohammad Shami instead of Harshal Patel. "We're playing in Australia, the guy [Shami] has got the real action...bounce...he can get on early wickets," he added. Shami has been named as a standby for the World Cup.

289.title: Why Marathi Manoos have been thrown out from Mumbai?: CM Shinde to Uddhav
289.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde has "challenged" former CM Uddhav Thackeray to "publish the statistics of how many" Marathi speaking people are "left in Mumbai". "For many years they (Thackeray-led Sena) kept seeking votes in the name of Marathi people. You should answer why the Marathi Manoos have been thrown out from Mumbai to the outskirts like Virar," he said.

290.title: Woman saved while crossing train track risks life again for water bottle in UP
290.article_body: A video has shown a woman being rescued while crossing train tracks in UP and then risking her life again to get her water bottle. An IRTS officer shared the video which showed the woman getting the bottle kept at the edge of the platform, just as the train went by. "Such people should be fined," said a Twitter user.

291.title: Sikandar Raza creates history, becomes 1st player from Zimbabwe to win ICC monthly award
291.article_body: All-rounder Sikandar Raza has created history by becoming the first Zimbabwe player to win the ICC Men's Player of the Month award. Raza beat New Zealand all-rounder Mitchell Santner and England all-rounder Ben Stokes to claim the monthly award for August, with the 36-year-old scoring three ODI centuries during the month alone. "I'm incredibly humbled and honoured," Raza said.

292.title: Messi, Mbappe among highest ranked in FIFA 23 as Ronaldo slips below
292.article_body: Lionel Messi, Karim Benzema, Robert Lewandowski, Kylian Mbappe and Kevin De Bruyne are the highest-ranked players with 91 points in EA Sports' FIFA 23 game. Manchester United forward Cristiano Ronaldo features among the second-highest scorers with 90 points. Liverpool players Mohamed Salah and Virgil van Dijk have also been marked at par with Ronaldo, while PSG's Neymar has 89 points.

293.title: Kejriwal has dinner at Guj auto driver's home after police stops him on way
293.article_body: Delhi CM and AAP chief Arvind Kejriwal on Monday had dinner at the house of an auto-rickshaw driver, who had invited him earlier in the day, in Gujarat's Ahmedabad. Kejriwal was earlier stopped by Gujarat Police from visiting the driver's house, citing security reasons. "We don't want your security...You've held us hostage," Kejriwal said, while arguing with a police officer.

294.title: God save him from the evil eye: Pakistan head coach Saqlain Mushtaq on Babar Azam
294.article_body: Talking about Babar Azam, who scored 68 runs in six Asia Cup 2022 matches, Pakistan head coach Saqlain Mushtaq said, "Anybody with a deep eye of cricket will realise...he's unlucky with the way he's getting out." He added, "The way he plays and his work ethic needs no further discussion. He's a world-class player and God save him from...evil eye."

295.title: Man calls Queen's son Andrew 'sick old man' at funeral procession, arrested; video out
295.article_body: A man was arrested on Monday for heckling Queen Elizabeth's son Prince Andrew during her funeral procession in Scotland's Edinburgh. The incident happened when King Charles and Prince Andrew followed the Queen's coffin that was being brought to St Giles' Cathedral. "Andrew, you're a sick old man," shouted the heckler. Prince Andrew has been accused of sexual assault.

296.title: Pickpockets also join Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Kerala
296.article_body: While the Congress' 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' in Kerala drew a crowd of thousands of people, it also drew in pickpockets. A police officer said that pickpocketing incidents were reported in some areas and after examining the CCTV footage, they identified a gang of four people. "Not sure if...they were behind the reported incidents of pickpocketing," the officer said.

297.title: Six-year-old girl raped by 22-year-old man in Ranchi
297.article_body: A six-year-old girl was allegedly raped by a 22-year-old man in Jharkhand's Ranchi district. The accused had allegedly lured the victim with chocolates before committing the crime, police said. "The accused was arrested based on a complaint lodged at Namkum Police Station. The girl has been sent for medical examination," said Ranchi Superintendent of Police (Rural) Naushad Alam.

298.title: Akshay Kumar's hairdresser Milan passes away, actor says 'Still can't believe you left us'
298.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar took to Twitter to condole the demise of his hairdresser Milan Jadhav. Akshay wrote, "You stood out of the crowd with your funky hairstyles and infectious smile. Always ensured not even one hair of mine was out of place." He added, "The life of the set...my hairdresser for more than 15 years...Still can’t believe you’ve left us."

299.title: Dreams do come true: Dinesh Karthik on being included in India's T20 World Cup squad
299.article_body: After being included in India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad, Dinesh Karthik tweeted, "Dreams do come true." The last time Karthik was included in India's T20 World Cup squad was for the 2010 edition. The 37-year-old has played 50 T20Is for India so far, scoring 592 runs at a strike rate of 139.95.

300.title: Salman meets Jain monk Acharya Vijay Hansratnasur during latter's 180 days fast
300.article_body: Salman Khan recently met Jain monk Acharya Vijay Hansratnasur during the latter's 180 days of fasting. According to followers of Acharya, the actor sought blessings from the monk and he also learnt various aspects and rituals of Jainism. Reportedly, the 56-year-old Jain monk ended his 180 days of continuous fasting on Sunday, September 11.

301.title: We played to get result in shortened 3rd Test: Stokes after win over SA
301.article_body: After England won the third Test by nine wickets and clinched the three-match series 2-1 against South Africa, England skipper Ben Stokes said his side's main aim was to get a result after the Test was shortened at The Oval. Play was suspended on Day 2 after Queen Elizabeth II's demise. England's Ollie Robinson was adjudged 'Player of the Match'.

302.title: MeitY Startup Hub & Meta collaborate to accelerate XR tech startups
302.article_body: MeitY Startup Hub, an initiative of the Ministry of Electronics and IT, will collaborate with Facebook's parent company, Meta, to accelerate and support XR (Extended Reality) technology startups in India. In a statement, the Ministry said, "This collaboration is part of the government's efforts for skilling in emerging and future technologies." The programme will be launched on September 13.

303.title: SGPC holds protests in Punjab demanding release of Sikh prisoners
303.article_body: The SGPC, India's apex gurdwara body, on Monday staged protests at various places in Punjab, demanding the release of Sikh prisoners who have "completed their sentence". It has called for the release of several Sikh prisoners, including those arrested in connection with terror and separatist activities. SGPC has alleged discrimination against such prisoners with respect to the grant of remission.

304.title: Arti Singh says she lost 5 kg in 18 days, shares transformation video
304.article_body: Former 'Bigg Boss' contestant and actress Arti Singh took to Instagram and shared a transformation video of herself in which she can be seen working out. "18 days. 71.21 kg to 66.84 kg...Not giving up," Arti wrote along with the video. Reacting to the video, actress Rashmi Desai commented, "Proud of you babe." Several fans also reacted to her post.

305.title: Rajamouli was paid ₹10 cr to promote Brahmastra's Telugu version: Reports
305.article_body: Filmmaker SS Rajamouli reportedly received ₹10 crore from producer Karan Johar for the promotions of the Telugu version of 'Brahmastra'. The 'RRR' director promoted and presented the film in Andhra Pradesh and Telangana. According to reports, the Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer film has been made on a budget of ₹410 crore.

306.title: Bessemer Venture Partners closes 2 funds at $4.6 bn to back startups
306.article_body: Venture capital firm Bessemer Venture Partners (BVP) has closed $4.6 billion in new capital for two funds, the BVP XII and BVP Forge Fund, to back startups. The BVP XII fund will focus on seed and early-stage investments, while the Forge Fund will focus on growth buyout. BVP claims to have more than $20 billion in Assets Under Management (AUM).

307.title: India's agri-food products export up 30% in first 4 months of FY23
307.article_body: India's overall export of agricultural and processed food products increased by 30% to $9.59 billion in the first four months (April-July) of FY23 compared to the corresponding period of FY 2021-22, DGCI&S data showed. Further, the export of fresh fruits and vegetables registered a 4% growth, while processed fruits and vegetables recorded a 51% growth in the April-July period.

308.title: Used to get around ₹1-1.5 lakh for full film in 80s: Mandakini
308.article_body: Veteran actress Mandakini, who made her debut in 1985, said in an interview that actresses were not "very much in demand" in those days, adding that they were "used only for a few songs and romantic scenes". "When we used to work in films, we used to earn around ₹1-1.5 lakh for the full film," Mandakini further said.

309.title: 6 Syrian refugees found dead on boat reaching Italian port
309.article_body: Six Syrian refugees, including three children, were found dead on a migrant boat that arrived in the Italian port of Pozzallo on Monday, the UNHCR said. "They died of thirst, hunger and severe burns," UNHCR's representative to Italy stated. As per the UN agency, the deceased were among those 26 people who had been on the boat for several days.

310.title: Don't know why Babar was dragging the match: Moin Khan
310.article_body: Former Pakistan cricketer Moin Khan has questioned skipper Babar Azam's captaincy in the Asia Cup final against Sri Lanka. "We (Pakistan) should have attacked with our main bowlers, the fast bowlers. That's what common sense says," Moin said. He added, "I don't know why Babar was dragging the match...I guess he started thinking about the final overs. That's negative thinking."

311.title: Hope to never play another Spaniard in a Grand Slam final: Casper Ruud
311.article_body: Norwegian tennis player Casper Ruud said he hoped he didn't have to play any Spanish player in a Grand Slam final. "They know what they're doing in the Slam finals," said Ruud. The world number two lost to Carlos Alcaraz in the US Open 2022 final and earlier in the year lost the French Open final to Rafael Nadal.

312.title: UP govt demolishes 'illegal' madrasa in Amethi
312.article_body: A madrasa, which was built "illegally" on government land, was demolished in Amethi, Uttar Pradesh. The madrasa was built on grazing land along the Banda-Tanda highway in 2009, Amethi DM Rakesh Kumar Mishra said. A fine of ₹2.24 lakh has been imposed on the building's owner. The madrasa was built with the intention to grab the land, officials said.

313.title: Was called hanger in school for being too skinny: Tejasswi Prakash
313.article_body: Actress Tejasswi Prakash revealed that she was called a "hanger" in her school days as she was too skinny. "When we used to play on our school's playground...people used to tell me 'Keep a ₹5 coin in your pocket or you'll fly away'," she added. The actress, who is also the winner of 'Bigg Boss 15', features in 'Naagin 6'.

314.title: Future is here: Roddick after 19-yr-old Alcaraz's 1st-ever Grand Slam title
314.article_body: Praising 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz following his first-ever Grand Slam win at US Open 2022, Andy Roddick said, "Future is here. What a pleasure it's been to see Alcaraz improve so quickly." He added, "Youngest number one in the history of our game...As mature/nice off the court as he is dynamic on it. Cheers to the first of many majors Carlitos!"

315.title: After Apple, Google plans to make Pixel phones in India: Report
315.article_body: Amid supply disruptions due to COVID-19 restrictions in China, Google is planning to shift some production of Pixel phones to India, a report said. Google has reportedly asked Indian manufacturers to submit bids for the assembly of five lakh-ten lakh units of its Pixel smartphones. Earlier, a report said that Apple is planning to begin manufacturing iPhone 14 in India.

316.title: Asia Cup 2022 ends as a nightmare tournament for Babar, Fakhar: Akhtar
316.article_body: Criticising Pakistan captain Babar Azam and batter Fakhar Zaman, ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar said the Asia Cup 2022 "ends a nightmare tournament for Babar as a batter. Same disaster for Fakhar". He added, "This combination is not working. Pakistan has to look into a lot of things." In six matches, Babar and Zaman scored 68 and 96 runs respectively.

317.title: On-field conditions were not up to mark in 1st T20I vs England: Mandhana
317.article_body: Talking about India Women-England Women first T20I, India opener Smriti Mandhana said the on-field conditions in Chester-le-Street were not up to the mark to hold an international match. "As a team, we did have a discussion because we didn't play the brand of cricket that we've been playing for...last two months," she added. India lost the match by nine wickets.

318.title: Why doesn't BJP use agencies to find out who's not Indian?: Baghel on CAA
318.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel said the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA) targets the poor and underprivileged and asked why BJP doesn't "use [central] agencies to find out who's not an Indian". "CAA means that I have to prove that I am an Indian...It's not just about the Muslims, Muslims are very smart and have kept all their documents properly," Baghel added.

319.title: TMC to bring resolution in Assembly against 'misuse' of ED, CBI
319.article_body: The Trinamool Congress, led by West Bengal CM Mamata Banerjee, will bring a resolution in the state Assembly against the "misuse" of central agencies like ED and CBI. "They are being used by the Centre to harass non-BJP governments in various states," Parliamentary Affairs Minister Sobhandeb Chattopadhyay said. He added that Opposition BJP may take part in the discussion.

320.title: Rat's head found in food ordered from restaurant, claims TN family; probe launched
320.article_body: A family in Tamil Nadu's Arani has claimed that they found a 'rat's head' in a beetroot fry parcel delivered by a restaurant on Sunday. The family had ordered 35 parcels of food for their guests who had assembled at their house for a condolence event. After the restaurant denied the allegations, police sent the food for testing.

321.title: Kabir Singh became family film despite being edgy, aggressive: Shahid
321.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor, speaking about his 2019 film 'Kabir Singh', has said that it was "technically" an adult film. "The number of people who have liked it and watched it with their families is unbelievable. Somehow, it made it to the family space despite being edgy and aggressive," he stated. Actress Kiara Advani had featured in the film.

322.title: 4,449 families evicted across Assam under current BJP-led govt's tenure
322.article_body: A total of 4,449 families have been evicted across Assam for alleged encroachment since BJP's Himanta Biswa Sarma was elected as Chief Minister in May 2021. Sarma said the government hasn't carried out any investigation on whether the evicted families were Indian or not. We're not aware if evicted families were homeless people due to erosion, Sarma added.

323.title: Abrdn Plc to sell 43 mn shares in HDFC Life via block deal: Report
323.article_body: Edinburg-based finance and insurance company Abrdn Plc is expected to sell 43 million shares in HDFC Life Insurance Company in the price band of ₹564-578.5 per share, a report quoting sources said. The deal is likely to happen through a block deal. The insurance company is also expected to raise up to $313 million through the sale of the shares.

324.title: Prabhas to burn Ravan's effigy at Delhi's Lav Kush Ramleela this year
324.article_body: Actor Prabhas will burn the effigy of Ravan at the Lav Kush Ramleela in Delhi this year. The festivities will commence on September 26 and will conclude on October 5. "Since Prabhas is already playing role of Lord Rama in 'Adipurush'...who better than him to set...evilness of Raavan on fire this Dussehra," Lav Kush Ramleela committee head Arjun Kumar said.

325.title: Which 6 Indians from last year's T20 WC squad don't feature in T20 WC 2022 squad?
325.article_body: As many as six Indian players, who featured in India's T20 World Cup 2021 squad, are not a part of T20 World Cup 2022 squad. Ravindra Jadeja doesn't feature in the squad as he is recuperating from a knee injury. The other five players are Rahul Chahar, Varun Chakaravarthy, Ishan Kishan, Mohammad Shami and Shardul Thakur.

326.title: Shabana attends 'What's Love...' screening at TIFF, shares pics
326.article_body: Actress Shabana Azmi recently attended the screening of her film 'What's Love Got to Do with It?' at the Toronto International Film Festival (TIFF). She took to Instagram to share a few pictures where she can be seen posing with her co-stars Lily James and Sajal Aly. It is a British romantic comedy directed by Indian director Shekhar Kapur.

327.title: Cong cannot be wished away, have more seats than regional parties: Tejashwi
327.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav said that they "cannot wish away the fact" that Congress' numbers are higher than RJD and other regional parties in the Parliament. "Others (parties) are...limited to their own states," Yadav said. He added, "Their (BJP) strength has already come down after the JD(U)'s departure...If we join hands...then BJP will...stop short of the halfway mark."

328.title: What is the IPL team-wise distribution of India’s T20 World Cup 2022 squad?
328.article_body: India's 15-member squad for T20 World Cup 2022 was announced on Monday. Mumbai Indians and Royal Challengers Bangalore have the joint-highest representation in the squad among IPL teams, with three players each. They're followed by Delhi Capitals, Lucknow Super Giants and Rajasthan Royals, with two players each. One player each from SunRisers Hyderabad, Punjab Kings and Gujarat Titans is included.

329.title: Mom said it's okay if I freeze my eggs or be single mother: Mrunal
329.article_body: Actress Mrunal Thakur, during a conversation with Shriya Pilgaonkar, was asked if she has people in her life who make her aware of her "ticking biological clock". To this, she replied, "There are times when I feel I want to have a baby." Mrunal revealed her mother said it's okay if she freezes her eggs or becomes a single mother.

330.title: 5 aides of Nigerian lawmaker killed in attack on convoy
330.article_body: Five aides of a Nigerian Senator were killed when unidentified gunmen attacked his convoy in Anambra state on Sunday evening, the lawmaker's spokesman said. Senator Ifeanyi Ubah escaped unhurt as he was travelling in a bullet-proof vehicle, the spokesman informed. Separatist group Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) has been previously accused by the government of carrying out such attacks.

331.title: India's Jehan Daruvala wins Formula 2 feature race at Monza, finishes 3rd in sprint race
331.article_body: India's Jehan Daruvala won the Formula 2 feature race at Monza and finished third in the sprint race at the track. "Yesss, P1...A big thanks to the boys and girls @PREMA_Team - the car was rapid and the pit-stop amazing...Feels good to go into the break with a double podium under my belt!" he tweeted.

332.title: We smile knowing you & grandpa are reunited: Harry in 1st statement on Queen's death
332.article_body: Prince Harry on Monday released his first statement on Queen Elizabeth's death and addressed her directly, saying, "Granny...You are already sorely missed, not just by us, but by the world over." He said, "Thank you for your commitment to service...Thank you for your infectious smile. We, too, smile knowing that you and grandpa are reunited now."

333.title: I shouldn't have made Dhaakad: Hansal to user saying 'you gave Kangana a flop'
333.article_body: Hansal Mehta reacted after a Twitter user accused him of giving Kangana Ranaut a flop film after the filmmaker praised 'Brahmastra' on the social media platform. The user wrote, "Shame on you. You gave a flop film to Kangana." To this, he replied, "I shouldn't have made 'Dhaakad'." 'Dhaakad' was directed by Razneesh Ghai and had failed to perform.

334.title: Congress will not weaken itself for Opposition unity: Jairam Ramesh
334.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said Opposition unity for 2024 "doesn't mean weakening" the party. "Our allies should also understand that we will not allow ourselves to be weakened further...A strong Congress is an important pillar of Opposition unity," said Ramesh. He added that the BJP is "rattled" by seeing the support that 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' and Rahul Gandhi are getting.

335.title: Flipkart co-founder Sachin Bansal's Navi Technologies gets SEBI nod for ₹3,350 cr IPO
335.article_body: Flipkart co-founder Sachin Bansal's fintech startup Navi Technologies has received approval from the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) for a ₹3,350 crore Initial Public Offering (IPO). Navi Technologies submitted its draft papers in March 2022. The company reported a profit of ₹71.1 crore in FY21 and incurred losses of ₹206.42 crore in the first nine months of FY22.

336.title: Haridwar hate speech accused Jitendra Tyagi granted bail by SC
336.article_body: Supreme Court on Monday granted bail to Haridwar hate speech accused Jitendra Narayan Tyagi. The court asked him not to make any statement in the media with regard to the pending case. Tyagi, along with Yati Narsinghanand, was accused of hurting religious sentiments after videos of their speeches at Dharma Sansad surfaced on social media.

337.title: Iran says it has developed drone designed to hit Israeli cities
337.article_body: Iran has developed an advanced long-range suicide drone capable of striking Israeli cities, the chief of Iranian ground forces said, as per a semi-official news agency. "We have specially designed this drone for Haifa and Tel Aviv," Brigadier General Kioumars Heidari stated. "We will reveal its capabilities in future drills," he added. The drone has been named 'Arash-2', Heidari informed.

338.title: 10 dead so far after poll candidate distributes hooch in U'khand
338.article_body: Two more persons who fell ill after consuming illicit liquor distributed by a panchayat election candidate in Uttarakhand have died, taking the total number of deaths in the case to 10, police said. Two other persons are currently undergoing treatment. Uttarakhand Chief Minister Pushkar Singh Dhami has ordered a magisterial probe into the incident.

339.title: Over 67,000 cattle died since July due to lumpy skin disease: Centre
339.article_body: The Centre said over 67,000 cattle have died since July due to the lumpy skin disease with the 'goat pox' vaccine still being used. "In Rajasthan, the number of death is 600-700 per day...in other states, it is less than 100," said an official. A new 'Lumpi-ProVacInd' vaccine will take three-four months to be commercially available, added the official.

340.title: She kept her promises with dignity: Olivia Colman on Queen Elizabeth II
340.article_body: Actress Olivia Colman, speaking about Queen Elizabeth II's legacy, has said, "She made a promise as a young woman and she absolutely kept it with such dignity." Olivia played Queen Elizabeth II in two seasons of the series 'The Crown'. The actress further said that King Charles III is going to do a good job. Queen passed away on Thursday.

341.title: SL played superb, hard luck for Pak in Asia Cup final: Afghanistan's Gurbaz
341.article_body: Afghanistan opener Rahmanullah Gurbaz took to Twitter following Sri Lanka's Asia Cup win and wrote, "Congratulations to Sri Lanka...They played superb. Hard luck for Pakistan. It was a good tournament for all the teams to prepare for T20 World Cup 2022." Notably, Afghanistan were the only team to defeat Sri Lanka in the tournament. Sri Lanka beat Pakistan in final.

342.title: Air India to get 30 new planes in 1st big expansion since acquisition
342.article_body: Air India has signed agreements for 25 Airbus and five Boeing aircraft which will enter service in late 2022. Marking the airline's first major fleet expansion since its acquisition by the Tata Group, the Boeings will be deployed on existing routes between India and US. The airline will also offer Premium Economy flights for the first time on international flights.

343.title: Govt plans ₹20,000 cr aid to oil firms hit by rising costs: Report
343.article_body: Government is planning to pay around ₹20,000 crore to the state-run fuel retailers to compensate them for losses and keep a check on cooking gas prices, a report quoting people familiar with the matter said. Oil Ministry has reportedly sought a ₹28,000 crore-compensation, but the Finance Ministry is agreeing for only ₹20,000-crore. The talks are reportedly at an advanced stage.

344.title: Conspiracy against me: Punjab minister after 'extortion' audio clip goes viral
344.article_body: An audio clip of a conversation allegedly between Punjab minister Fauja Singh Sarari and his close aide has surfaced online in which the duo can be purportedly heard discussing a plan to extort money from officials and transporters. "The audio clip is fake and is a conspiracy against me," the minister said, while demanding action against those circulating the clip.

345.title: It’s a powerful action drama: Milap Zaveri on his upcoming directorial
345.article_body: Speaking about his upcoming directorial, Milap Zaveri has said that it is a work in progress. "It's a powerful action drama and will go on floors next year," he added. Along with his directorial, Milap revealed, "I'm also writing the story, screenplay and dialogues for Mohit Suri's next." He added, "I'm also penning the screenplay...dialogues for Remo D'Souza's next film."

346.title: Roman Reigns would smash MS Dhoni's numbers on cricket field, says WWE's Paul Heyman
346.article_body: WWE wrestler Roman Reigns' special counsel Paul Heyman took to Instagram Stories to react to a news article which recalled how he had asked ICC for royalties for allegedly paraphrasing his mantra 'Eat.
