Sleep. Conquer. Repeat' to praise MS Dhoni. He wrote, "For the record...my Tribal Chief...Reigns would smash Dhoni's numbers on the cricket field...and that's something everyone should acknowledge!"

347.title: Police conducts flag march in Ayodhya after Gyanvapi case verdict
347.article_body: Police conducted a flag march in Uttar Pradesh's Ayodhya after the Varanasi district court's verdict on the Gyanvapi case on Monday. The Varanasi court agreed to hear a group of Hindu women's plea seeking access to pray inside the Gyanvapi mosque. The Anjuman Intezamia Masjid Committee had questioned the maintainability of the Hindu side's plea.

348.title: Criminal who escaped from jail caught by villagers in Meghalaya
348.article_body: A day after four of the six undertrial prisoners, who had escaped from a jail in Meghalaya, were lynched by a mob, villagers on Monday caught the fifth criminal and handed him over to the police. The prisoner was allegedly tied up and paraded through the village, as per reports. The sixth prisoner is yet to be apprehended.

349.title: E-auction of 10 commercial coal mines to start tomorrow: Ministry
349.article_body: Coal Ministry has said that e-auction for 10 coal mines will be launched on Tuesday, adding that technical evaluation of bids has been completed, a PIB release said. E-auction for the mines will be conducted on two days, i.e., Tuesday and Wednesday. Total peak rate capacity of the mines being put up for e-auction is 39.31 million tons per annum.

350.title: Event celebrating men's divorce cancelled after protest in MP, pic of invite viral
350.article_body: An event to celebrate the divorce of 18 men, organised by NGO Bhai Welfare Society in MP's Bhopal, has been cancelled following protests. A card inviting people to the event, earlier scheduled to be held on September 18, had gone viral online. The invite mentioned various activities for the event like 'Jaimala Visarjan' and 'Gents Sangeet'.

351.title: Pune auto associations ask RTO to allow charging as per tariff card
351.article_body: The Pune autorickshaw associations have demanded that the RTO authorities allow them to charge customers as per new tariff card rates since the RTO is yet to calibrate some auto meters. The revised rates came into effect in Pune, Pimpri Chinchwad and Baramati from September 1. Of the 94,000 autorickshaws in Pune district, only 30,000 have been calibrated till now.

352.title: I often buy a lot of cheap things, the middle class in me hasn't gone: Rakul
352.article_body: Rakul Preet Singh in an interview said she often buys a lot of cheap things, adding, "I'm quite cheap that way...that middle class in me hasn't gone." She added she doesn't shop "with the price tag". "If I like something I'll pick it up from...normal brand...if I like something on high street I'll pick it up from there," said Rakul.

353.title: Rename new Parliament building after BR Ambedkar: T'gana CM to Centre
353.article_body: Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao said a resolution will be passed in the state Assembly, urging the Centre to rename the new Parliament building after BR Ambedkar. "(Ambedkar is) among people who made great efforts for welfare of downtrodden," KCR said. Telangana wouldn't have been formed if it weren't for a section that Ambedkar added in the Constitution, he added.

354.title: Amazon India marketplace revenue rises over 30%, net loss narrows
354.article_body: Amazon Seller Services, which runs Amazon India marketplace, recorded over a 30% rise in operational revenue, and its net loss narrowed in FY22 to ₹3,649 crore from ₹4,748 crore in FY21. Last year, Amazon Seller Services reported a 50% rise in revenue. Amazon Pay India, which runs payments services in India, reported a 16% rise in revenue from last year.

355.title: Vikram attends wedding of his house help's son, pics surface
355.article_body: Actor Vikram, who predominantly works in the Tamil film industry, recently attended the wedding of his house help's son at the Thiruporur Kandaswamy Temple in Tamil Nadu. Several pictures of Vikram in a white shirt and mundu have also surfaced online. The actor, known for films like 'I' and 'Anniyan', was recently seen in 'Cobra'.

356.title: Same path as that of Babri Masjid: Owaisi on court order in Gyanvapi case
356.article_body: We're going on the same path as that of the Babri Masjid issue, AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi said while reacting to Varanasi district court's order in the Gyanvapi case. The court has rejected the plea questioning maintainability of civil suits challenging Gyanvapi mosque's title. After this order, purpose of Places of Worship Act 1991 will fail, Owaisi added.

357.title: Centre mulls additional LPG subsidy of up to ₹30,000 crore: Report
357.article_body: The Centre is considering an additional subsidy of up to ₹30,000 crore to keep the retail price of LPG in check, CNBC TV18 reported. The additional subsidy will reportedly be "over and above" the budget earmarked for the Centre's Ujjwala scheme. The estimated amount is higher than the ₹5,812 crore marked as LPG subsidy in the budget estimate for FY23.

358.title: Noida projected to have 620 electric bikes by December end
358.article_body: By the end of December, 62 docking stations across Noida will be home to a total of 620 electric bicycles. Ten e-bicycles will be available at each station during the pilot programme started by the Noida Authority. The docking stations' locations include Sector 6 Noida Authority office, the Sectors 15, 16 and 18 metro stations and Botanical Garden, among others.

359.title: HC directs filing of PIL over deaths of 2 manual scavengers in Delhi
359.article_body: The Delhi High Court has directed that a Public Interest Litigation (PIL) be filed over the deaths of two manual scavengers in Delhi's Mundka. The court took suo motu cognisance of the deaths that resulted from them inhaling toxic gases inside a sewer while cleaning a drain. A case was registered under section 304A of the Indian Penal Code.

360.title: I don't wanna compare myself to Federer, Nadal, Djokovic: World no. 1 Alcaraz
360.article_body: Spain's 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz said it's "incredible" to be the youngest-ever world number one in men's tennis, but it's much tougher to stay on top for 20 years like the 'Big 3', Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic. "That's what I'm looking for. I don't wanna compare myself to them, but I wanna be like them," he added.

361.title: Jacqueline issued fresh summon in ₹200-crore money laundering case
361.article_body: Delhi Police's Economic Offences Wing on Monday issued a fresh summon to actress Jacqueline Fernandez to appear before it on September 14 in connection with an alleged ₹200-crore money laundering case. Earlier, she had asked to skip the summons over prior work commitments. ED has named Jacqueline in their chargesheet in money laundering cases that involve conman Sukesh Chandrasekhar.

362.title: 4 farm labourers killed, 5 injured in lightning strikes in Gujarat
362.article_body: Lightning strikes killed four tribal farm labourers and injured at least five others in Gujarat's Surat, Dang and Dediyapada on Sunday. The India Meteorological Department (IMD) had forecasted heavy rainfall in some parts of the state till September 16. In one of the incidents, four people were returning home from the fields in Surat when they were struck by lightning.

363.title: Some things never change: Abhishek on surprising father Big B on set
363.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan took to Instagram and shared a picture of his surprise visit to his father and actor Amitabh Bachchan's set. He also shared an old picture with his father. Along with the picture, Abhishek wrote, "Some things never change...Surprise visits to his set will always be one of my...favourite things to do."

364.title: Bombay HC orders probe against inspector who ensured minor's trial as adult
364.article_body: The Bombay HC has ordered a probe into allegations that a Mumbai Police inspector misled the Juvenile Justice Board to ensure a minor was tried as an adult. The minor, arrested in a murder case, was allegedly targeted as his father could not meet the officer's demand for ₹50,000. The boy had been lodged in the Thane Central Jail.

365.title: Baba Ramdev to launch IPO of 4 firms under Patanjali brand: Report
365.article_body: Yoga guru Baba Ramdev would launch the IPO of four companies under the Patanjali brand, a report said. The companies that'll be listed on the stock market during the next five years include Patanjali Ayurved, Patanjali Wellness, Patanjali Medicine and Patanjali Lifestyle. During an interview, Ramdev said that his company is planning to sell 6% promoters' stake in Patanjali Foods.

366.title: We've rejected Reliance Infra's ₹500-cr arbitration claim: Adani Transmission
366.article_body: Adani Transmission Ltd (ATL) on Monday said Reliance Infrastructure Ltd's ₹500-crore arbitration claim over a dispute under the share purchase agreement (SPA) in December 2021 has been rejected by it. These are afterthoughts and based on untenable positions, ATL said. It added that Reliance Infrastructure hasn't yet settled Adani Electricity Mumbai Ltd's significantly larger claims under the SPA.

367.title: NZ Rugby fined for not having 40% representation of women on board
367.article_body: New Zealand Rugby Chairman Stewart Mitchell has confirmed that the board has been penalised for not meeting Sport New Zealand's requirement for having a 40% representation of women on the board. According to a report, the country's apex body for rugby will lose $172,060 in funding from the government. Currently, three out of nine board members of NZR are female.

368.title: Woman arrested for stealing child from Mumbai to increase income
368.article_body: A 35-year-old Delhi woman was arrested for stealing the child of a Mumbai's Borivali-based couple in order to increase her source of income. Police say the couple had let the woman live with them for three days before she took off with the three-year-old boy. Police arrested the woman when she was trying to board a train from Dadar station.

369.title: Switzerland identifies site for nuclear waste storage facility
369.article_body: Switzerland's nuclear waste authority has identified a site for setting up the country's first permanent nuclear waste storage facility near the German border. The Swiss government, however, will need the parliament's approval before it can sign off on the proposed site. The proposal could also face a possible referendum. Construction of the storage facility is estimated to begin in 2045.

370.title: 4 coaches of passenger train derail in Odisha's Koraput; none hurt
370.article_body: At least four coaches of Visakhapatnam-Kirandul passenger special train derailed in Odisha's Koraput district on Monday, the East Coast Railway (ECoR) said in a statement. No casualties have been reported in the incident so far, officials said. "All passengers managed to get down safely from the train," Divisional Railway Manager Anup Satpathy said.

371.title: Sri Lanka showed true character as a unit to win Asia Cup 2022: Yuvraj
371.article_body: Congratulating Sri Lanka following their Asia Cup 2022 win, Yuvraj Singh said that they deserved to win the tournament. "After losing to Afghanistan in the first game [Sri Lanka] showed true character as a unit to win the tournament...well done skipper," he added. Sri Lanka won five matches in a row after losing to Afghanistan in their first match.

372.title: No reasons for Iran to reject EU's offer on nuclear deal: Germany
372.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Monday said Iran has no reason to reject the proposals by European countries on reviving the 2015 nuclear deal. It is regrettable that there has been no positive response to the proposal by Iran yet, Scholz added. Earlier this month, Iran sent its latest response to the EU's "final text" drafted for the pact's revival.

373.title: Pvt jets not allowed, world leaders to take bus to Queen's funeral in London: Report
373.article_body: World leaders and VIPs arriving in the UK for Queen Elizabeth's funeral have been asked to take commercial flights instead of private jets to transport them, Politico reported, citing a document. The attendees, including US President Joe Biden, can't take helicopters or state cars to the funeral, Politico said. They'll reportedly be taken to London's Westminster Abbey on a bus.

374.title: I feel proud we managed to create great energy at cinemas: Ayan on Brahmastra
374.article_body: Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt-starrer 'Brahmastra' has collected ₹225 crore worldwide within three days of its release, director Ayan Mukerji shared on Monday. "Brahmastra has gotten off to a great start with audiences over its first weekend," Ayan wrote, adding that he feels proud that the team "managed to create a great energy at...cinemas over the last three days".

375.title: Aaditya Thackeray could lose MCA membership for owing ₹7,941 in dues
375.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Aaditya Thackeray and his cousin Varun Sardesai are among the 92 individuals who have defaulted on their annual membership fees of the Mumbai Cricket Association (MCA), Kandivali. The MCA has written to the CEO asking for permission to cancel their memberships. Aaditya has a total outstanding of ₹7,941, while Sardesai's amount is pegged at ₹38,515.

376.title: Bodies of 3 teenage boys found from river after 3-day search in U'khand
376.article_body: The bodies of three boys, who were missing since September 10 in Uttarakhand's Pauri district, were found in a river on Monday. The boys, aged 13,15 and 16, had left their homes to stroll around the Duggada petrol pump area on a two-wheeler. The bodies were pulled out from the river with the help of ropes.

377.title: New sculptures installed in Pune to remain covered till inauguration: PCMC
377.article_body: The Pimpri Chinchwad Municipal Corporation (PCMC) installed sculptures across the city as part of a beautification process and they will remain covered till the inauguration, officials said. The project entails beautifying prominent chowks, and a team of artists from across the country was chosen to make sculptures using scrap material. Each sculpture will cost over ₹2 lakh, officials said.

378.title: BBMP begins demolition drive at 2 locations to clear stormwater drains
378.article_body: Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP) has started demolition drives at two locations in Bengaluru to clear stormwater drains following floods caused by heavy rains. While one BBMP team began demolitions in Mahadevapura zone, the other team started clearing parts of Ragam megastore in AECS Layout. BBMP Chief Engineer Basavaraj Kabade said, "20 buildings have encroached near Spice Garden Layout."

379.title: Does anyone want me to do it again?: Brie on playing 'Captain Marvel'
379.article_body: Actress Brie Larson, during D23 Expo, was asked how long she would play 'Captain Marvel' in MCU films. To this, she replied, "Does anyone want me to do it again? I...don't know. I don't have the answer to that." Brie first played the role in the 2019 film 'Captain Marvel'. She will next feature as Captain Marvel in 'The Marvels'.

380.title: 5 youths held for performing bike stunts in Chennai after video goes viral
380.article_body: Five bikers have been arrested for allegedly performing stunts on their bikes on Chennai road. A video showing the youths performing the stunts had gone viral. Twitter users had also tagged Chennai police and had called for action against the bikers. While two people were arrested on Saturday, police arrested three more accused on Sunday.

381.title: A weekend full of light: Alia as Brahmastra earns ₹225 cr worldwide in 3 days
381.article_body: As the worldwide box-office collection of 'Brahmastra' crossed ₹225 crore, Alia Bhatt took to Instagram on Monday to share a post thanking her fans. "A weekend full of light and our hearts full of love. So grateful for our audience," she wrote. The film was released in Hindi, Tamil, Telugu, Kannada and Malayalam on September 9.

382.title: Divorced man kidnaps girl to raise her as his child in Delhi; held
382.article_body: Delhi Police have rescued a four-year-old girl within 24 hours after she was kidnapped by a divorced man. The accused has been arrested and sent to judicial custody. "[He] is a divorcee and a drunkard. He wanted to raise the girl child as his own...But he got scared and had abandoned her on the way," a senior police official said.

383.title: 240 held for harassing women during Ganesh Chaturthi in Hyderabad
383.article_body: Hyderabad's SHE Team arrested 240 people for allegedly misbehaving with women during the recently concluded festival of Ganesh Chaturthi. The arrested were found to be touching women inappropriately, stalking them, and taking their pictures near Ganesh pandals across the city. SHE Team members were clad in plain clothes and were secretly carrying cameras.

384.title: Ratnam's 'Ponniyin Selvan' sold for ₹125 cr to OTT platform: Report
384.article_body: The 'Ponniyin Selvan' franchise has reportedly been sold for ₹125 crore to an OTT platform. Filmmaker Mani Ratnam is the director of the two-film franchise. The first instalment of 'Ponniyin Selvan' will release on September 30. The film will feature Vikram, Karthi, Trisha Krishnan and Aishwarya Rai Bachchan.

385.title: Pakistan played well in Asia Cup, but not very well: Inzamam
385.article_body: Former Pakistan skipper Inzamam-ul-Haq said that Pakistan played "well" in the recently-concluded Asia Cup tournament, but not "very well". "Many of their (Pakistan) flaws were on show. They could not capitalize on the pressure, which helped them reduce Sri Lanka for 58-5 at one stage of the game," Inzamam said. He added that the Lankan pacers had done their "homework".

386.title: Ethereum blockchain may be upgraded this week to cut energy use by 99.9%: Report
386.article_body: Ethereum blockchain is expected to undergo a software upgrade this week to allow it to consume 99.95% lesser energy than it currently does to create ether tokens, Reuters reported. The Ethereum Foundation said the upgrade, known as 'The Merge', will take place between September 10-20. The upgrade may widen the technology's use and support ether token's price.

387.title: Someone in your office ate your dosa: Cong to Tejasvi Surya
387.article_body: Responding to BJP leader Tejasvi Surya's comment that he didn't receive the parcel of dosas sent by Congress, party leader Tejesh Kumar C said that someone in Surya's office ate his dosas. "It's been more than 24 hours & I still haven't received it. They can't deliver a dosa properly and they dream of delivering good governance!" Surya previously said.

388.title: 40-yr-old man stabs 25-yr-old woman for abusing his mother in Delhi
388.article_body: A 25-year-old woman was allegedly stabbed by her 40-year-old neighbour in Delhi's Sagarpur for abusing his mother, officials said on Monday. The accused was under the influence of alcohol during the altercation, said DCP (southwest) Manoj C said. The accused alleged the woman had abused his mother, which angered him, he said, adding that he used a kitchen knife.

389.title: School bus with students catches fire in Navi Mumbai, no casualty
389.article_body: A school bus carrying students caught fire in Navi Mumbai's Kharghar area on Monday, officials said, adding that no injuries were reported. Four students of a school, a staffer and a driver were present in the vehicle when it caught fire, a fire official said. The fire was doused within 15 minutes, the official added.

390.title: There's wave of happiness: UP Deputy CM as Gyanvapi suit held maintainable
390.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Deputy Chief Minister Brajesh Pathak said there is a wave of happiness after the Varanasi district court held that a group of Hindu women's plea seeking access to pray inside the Gyanvapi mosque was maintainable. "I'm receiving many phone calls expressing happiness," Pathak said. The Anjuman Committee had said that the Gyanvapi mosque is a Waqf property.

391.title: Pregnant woman carried on stretcher, delivers baby in forest in Maha
391.article_body: A pregnant tribal woman was carried on a makeshift stretcher due to lack of a proper road in a village in Maharashtra's Palghar district, officials said on Monday. The 21-year-old woman delivered the baby in a dense and dark forest in Maharashtra. A video of the woman being carried by some people surfaced on social media.

392.title: Tyres stolen from 3 cars in Delhi's Greater Kailash, probe on
392.article_body: Thieves in Delhi's Greater Kailash area stole tyres from at least three cars in the early hours of Monday, the police said, adding that the accused took all four tyres of one car. CCTV footage of the incident shows a man getting out of a car around 3 am, quickly removing tyres and then escaping.

393.title: Team India squads for T20I series against Australia and South Africa announced
393.article_body: The BCCI has announced Team India squads for T20I series against Australia and South Africa. Fast bowler Mohammad Shami, who has been named standby player for India's T20 World Cup 2022 squad, features in squads for both series. Bhuvneshwar Kumar and Hardik Pandya have been included in squad for Australia T20Is, while they have been rested for South Africa T20Is.

394.title: Retail inflation rises to 7% in August after falling for 3 straight months
394.article_body: The country’s retail inflation, which is measured by the Consumer Price Index (CPI), rose to 7% in the month of August after falling for three straight months, government data showed. The CPI stood at 6.71% in July, 7.01% in June and 7.04% in May. In April, the CPI had hit an eight-year-high of 7.79%.

395.title: Man stabs 2 brothers over argument about a girl in Delhi, 1 dead
395.article_body: A 20-year-old man was declared dead, while his 21-year-old brother sustained injuries after their friend stabbed them over an argument about a girl in Delhi, officials said on Monday. The accused was in a relationship with the woman in question, said DCP (north) Sagar Singh Kalsi, adding that the victims had passed comments about her a few days back.

396.title: I will feature in season 2 of 'Duranga': Actor Amit Sadh
396.article_body: Actor Amit Sadh has revealed that he will be featuring in the next season of 'Duranga'. "I am happy to see the outpouring of love for my cameo role in Duranga. I have huge admiration for the whole team...especially the cast who have worked so hard to make a complex series," he stated. Gulshan Devaiah featured in the first season.

397.title: UAE court rejects Danish extradition plea for fraud case accused
397.article_body: An Emirati court has ruled that the prime suspect in a $1.7 billion tax fraud case cannot be extradited to Denmark. Sanjay Shah is wanted by Danish authorities for his alleged involvement in one of Denmark's largest-ever fraud cases. The case pertains to an elaborate scheme as part of which ineligible foreign businesses claimed tax refunds from the Danish exchequer.

398.title: Vedanta picks Gujarat for its $20-bn joint venture with Foxconn: Report
398.article_body: Vedanta has picked Gujarat to set up a semiconductor plant under its $20-billion joint venture with Taiwan's Foxconn, Reuters reported. Vedanta reportedly obtained financial and non-financial subsidies, including cheap electricity, from Gujarat to build the semiconductor plants. Vedanta had sought 1,000 acres of land free-of-cost on a 99-year lease while lobbying for incentives with states.

399.title: Muslim petitioners to move HC in Gyanvapi case as Hindu suit held maintainable
399.article_body: After Varanasi district court agreed to hear Hindu women's plea seeking access to pray inside Gyanvapi mosque, Muslim petitioners said they'll move to the High Court. Uttar Pradesh Minority Minister Danish Azad Ansari said the court verdict should be respected. The Anjuman Intezamia Masjid Committee had questioned the maintainability of Hindu side's plea, saying the mosque was a Waqf property.

400.title: Ex-Gazprom unit to pay penalty for failed LNG deliveries to India: Official
400.article_body: A former unit of Russia's Gazprom will pay a penalty for the LNG cargoes it failed to deliver to India since early June, said an official. Under a 20-year contract, Gazprom Marketing and Trading Singapore was to supply 2.5 million tonnes of LNG to GAIL (India) this year and will now pay a penalty of 20% of the agreed price.

401.title: These 2 weeks have been incredible: Alcaraz on 1st Grand Slam win, no. 1 spot
401.article_body: After winning his maiden Grand Slam title at US Open and becoming the youngest men's world number one, 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz tweeted, "These two weeks have been incredible and have included some very tough matches." He added, "Thank you NYC for the support...energy on court is impossible to explain! And thank you everyone on the other side of the world."

402.title: Article 370 will be restored in J&K: Mufti on Azad's can't be restored remark
402.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir CM Mehbooba Mufti on Monday responded to Ghulam Nabi Azad's "Article 370 cannot be restored" remark and said that it was his "personal opinion". "There are voices in J&K who believe Article 370 will be reinstated," she said. Congress is making false promises if they're talking about restoring Article 370, Azad previously said.

403.title: Man allegedly rapes dancer on pretext of taking audition in Gurugram
403.article_body: A man allegedly raped a 37-year-old professional dancer on the pretext of taking a dance audition in Gurugram. The woman alleged that he also filmed the act and had physical relations with her several times. "He threatened to kill me when I resisted...After...long time, I decided to move to police," she added. Police have registered a case into the matter.

404.title: Team India squad for T20 World Cup 2022 announced
404.article_body: The BCCI today announced the 15-member Team India squad for T20 World Cup 2022. Rohit Sharma will be captaining India in a major ICC tournament for the first time. The squad includes Harshal Patel, who will be featuring in his maiden T20 World Cup. Leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal, who wasn't selected for last year's T20 World Cup, features in the squad.
